tool.name: CreateReferenceSystemGRGFromArea
tool.displayname: Create Reference System GRG from Area

param.name: input_area_features
param.dialogReference: Select an area feature class or draw an area on the map to create a reference grid.

param.name: input_grid_reference_system
param.dialogReference:
Select the grid type to create:

  • MGRS: Military Grid Reference System (default)

  • USNG: United States National Grid

param.name: grid_square_size
param.dialogReference:
Select the size of the grid to create:

  • GRID_ZONE_DESIGNATOR - grids will be of the Grid Zone Designator (GZD) and Latitude Band combination, ex. 4Q

  • 100000M_GRID - grids will be 100,000 m grid square, ex. 4QFJ

  • 10000M_GRID - grids will be 10,000m grid square, ex. 4QFJ16

  • 1000M_GRID - grids will be 1,000m grid square, ex. 4QFJ1267

  • 100M_GRID - grids will be 100m grid square, ex. 4QFJ123678

  • 10M_GRID - grids will be 10m grid square, ex. 4QFJ12346789

param.name: output_grid_features
param.dialogReference: Type (or browse to) the path and name of the features to create.

param.name: large_grid_handling
param.dialogReference:
Select how to handle large areas that may contain many features.

  • NO_LARGE_GRIDS - Tool will stop processing if more than 2000 features will be created.

  • ALLOW_LARGE_GRIDS - Features will be created regardless of the number of features.

tool.summary: Creates grid features for Military Grid Reference System (MGRS) or United States National Grid (USNG) reference grids.
tool.usage:
• An irregularly shaped Input Area Feature will be completely enclosed by the resulting Output Grid Features. The maximum extent of the Input Area Features is used to build the reference grid.

  • Use Clip (Analysis Tools) to cut the Output Grid Features to a specific shape.

  • Output Grid Features will be in Geographic WGS 1984

  • Grid coordinate is stored in the Grid field in the Output Grid Features.

  • Use caution in selecting an Input Area that may be smaller than the selected Grid Square Size. The resulting grid may be much larger than the selected area.

  • Conversely, be careful in selecting a large area, and a small Grid Square Size as it may create many small grids in a large dataset.

  • Large Grid Handling is based on the extent area (not actual area) of the Input Grid Area. The critical values that will stop when NO_LARGE_GRIDS is selected for the Grid Square Sizes are:

    • Areas larger than ~200,000 square meters for 10M_GRID.

    • Areas larger than ~20,000,000 square meters for 100M_GRID.

    • Areas larger than ~2,000,000,000 square meters for 1000M_GRID.

    • Areas larger than ~200,000,000,000 square meters for 10000M_GRID.

idCitation.resTitle: Create Reference System GRG from Area

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Creates grid features for Military Grid Reference System (MGRS) or United States National Grid (USNG) reference grids.
